titleStmt.title: The Christians race teaching vs all so worthily, and so wisely both to beginne, continue, and to end, this our most short and momentanie [sic] course in this mortall life: that in the day of our death wee may for euer enjoy that inestimable crowne of eternall blisse in the life to come. Being a sermon preached in the Parish Church of North Parrott in Somerset, by Iohn Atkins Master of Arts, and preacher of the sacred Word of God, and pastor there.
titleStmt.author: Atkins, John, Rector of North Parrott.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by W. Stansby] for George Hodges, and are to bee sold at his shop in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Gray-hound,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Gray-hound
